metadata.title: CVE-2023-0547 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
OCSP revocation status of recipient certificates was not checked whensending S/Mime encrypted email, and revoked certificates would be accepted.Thunderbird versions from 68 to 102.9.1 were affected by this bug. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 102.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
